data.name: AlwaysOnTop.Help
data.value: Check to enable this window to be on top of all other windows.

data.name: AppApply.Help
data.value: Saves all changes you have made without shutting down the application or closing the dialog box.

data.name: AppCancel.Help
data.value: Shuts down the application and closes the dialog box without saving any changes you have made.

data.name: AppOK.Help
data.value: Closes the dialog box, saves any changes you have made and runs the application in the background.

data.name: AutoStartup.Help
data.value: Check to run this application automatically at user session startup.

data.name: Cancel.Help
data.value: Closes the dialog box without saving any changes you have made.

data.name: CurrentScreenKey.Help
data.value: Select a key to take a snapshot of the screen containing the mouse cursor.

data.name: DirectoryNotExist
data.value: The selected working directory does not exist.

data.name: ExternalApp.Help
data.value: Specify a path to the application that will open the captured image.

data.name: ExternalAppNotExecuted
data.value: The external application could not be started because the path was not found, the user does not have the rights to use the file, or the file is not a valid Win32 application.

data.name: ExternalAppNotFound
data.value: The external application file could not be found.

data.name: FileFormat.Help
data.value: Change the file format for the captured image.

data.name: FileName.Help
data.value:
Choose a filename for the captured image. The filename cannot start or end with a period or space or contain any of the following characters: \ / : * ? " < > |
Use the following shortcuts to make a pattern for the filename.
<counter> An integer that starts from 1 and is reset with every application restart.
<yyyy>, <MM>, <dd>, <hh>, <mm>, <ss> The shortcuts of the year, month, day, hour, minute and second from when the screenshot was taken.

data.name: ForegroundWindowKey.Help
data.value: Select a key to take a snapshot of the foreground window.

data.name: HowToUse
data.value:
Press the OK button to switch to background mode. To bring this window back use the "show this window" key configured in the Preferences tab.
To capture a window, press and hold the Print Screen key while moving the mouse over the area to capture. The selected area will be marked with the red rectangle. Release the Print Screen key to complete the operation.

data.name: ImageDestination.Help
data.value: Specify what to do with the captured image.

data.name: ImageQuality.Help
data.value: Change the quality level of the captured image. The better the quality, the larger the image file size tends to be.

data.name: ImageToClipboardFailed
data.value:
The captured image could not be saved to the clipboard.
This typically occurs when the clipboard is being used by another application.

data.name: IncludeCursor.Help
data.value: Check to enable capture of the mouse pointer.

data.name: InvalidDirectoryName
data.value: The specified working directory is either malformed or contains keywords reserved by the system.

data.name: InvalidExecutablePath
data.value: The specified path to the executable is either malformed or contains keywords reserved by the system.

data.name: InvalidFileName
data.value: The specified filename is either malformed or a keyword reserved by the system.

data.name: NoFullTrust
data.value:
The current security policy prevents this application from running.
This usually happens when the application is being launched directly from the Internet or network share.

data.name: OK.Help
data.value: Closes the dialog box and saves any changes you have made.

data.name: OsNotFullySupported
data.value: This application was not designed for the current platform. Some features may not behave as expected.

data.name: OsNotSupported
data.value: Goletas Screen Capture is not designed to run on the current operating system. The application will now exit.

data.name: RemoveApp
data.value: To completely uninstall this application, remove your settings and exit the program.

data.name: RemoveApp.Dialog
data.value: You are about to remove all application settings. Do you want to continue?

data.name: RemoveApp.Help
data.value: Removes all application settings for the current user. You have to manually delete the executable if you no longer wish to keep this application.

data.name: SelectExternalApp.Help
data.value: Select the external application that opens the captured image.

data.name: SelectWorkingDirectory.Help
data.value: Select a directory where the image files will be saved.

data.name: SettingsKey.Help
data.value: Select a key to show this window or bring it to top.

data.name: UnhandledException
data.value: An unexpected error has occurred and the application will now close.

data.name: UnhandledExceptionEx
UseExternalApp.Help
data.value: Check to open the captured image with the specified editor.

data.name: UseFileOverwrite.Help
data.value: Check this option to automatically overwrite a file with the same filename or leave unchecked for the filename prompt. Files with the Read Only or System attributes will not be overwritten.

data.name: VirtualScreenKey.Help
data.value: Select a key to take a snapshot of the entire virtual screen, that is, all screens.

data.name: WorkingDirectory.Description
data.value: Select the directory where the captured image files will be saved.

data.name: WorkingDirectory.Help
data.value: Specify the name of an existing directory where the image files will be saved.
